title: Homemade Salsa

ingredients.name: jalapeño pepper, seeded and roughly chopped

steps: Combine all ingredients in a food processor.
Pulse in 1-second bursts until all ingredients are finely chopped.
Taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed.
For best flavor, refrigerate for a few hours before serving to let flavors marinate together.
notes: Volume conversions: 1¼ lbs Roma tomatoes ≈ 567g (about 5-6 tomatoes), 14.5 oz can ≈ 411g, 2 green onions ≈ 30g, ⅓ cup red onion ≈ 50g, 1 jalapeño ≈ 15g, ⅓ cup cilantro ≈ 20g, 1 large garlic clove ≈ 5g, 2 tbsp lime juice ≈ 30g, ½ tsp chili powder ≈ 2g, ¼ tsp cumin ≈ 2g, ½ tsp sugar ≈ 2g
Use best quality tomatoes for best flavor
Can substitute canned diced tomatoes with green chilis or fire-roasted tomatoes
Leave jalapeño seeds for spicier salsa, or use serrano pepper
Can add ½ bell pepper, poblano, or Anaheim pepper
Add tomato juice or sauce for thinner consistency
Store in refrigerator up to 1 week
Salsa always tastes best after refrigeration
